title.narrative: Maa Habitat Restoration Initiative - Environmental Conservation and Afforestation in Trasmara District

description.narrative: Over time a lot of forest destruction has been taking place in these natural indigenous forests. Rampant forest destruction has taken place where it has reduced the forest cover by over 50%. This has led to manifold effects in the area including reduced ra infall intensity and coverage reduced and drying of water sources (springs and catchments) loss of some rare wildlife species to other forested habitats among others. Reduced rainfall amounts and coverage has eventually affected water and vegetation availa bility for people and livestock. The community?s livelihoods have been affected owing to reduced crop and livestock productivity. The trend of reducing vegetation cover has been upward and steady and of worrying magnitude. Some areas have remained bare and stood susceptible to serious soil erosion. Land degradation has set in to levels threatening food production. The main factors that have contributed to all these pressure to the residents to secure food and income for life leading to indulgence in forest destruction by charcoal burning ignorance of the repercussions of deforestation due to lack of awareness Lack of diversified income sources and change of land use to cultivable agriculture and settlement necessitating clearing of forests.Appropriate inter vention measures to this problem therefore require continuous and strategic efforts
